plan.reason: Identify the purpose and goals of the hackathon
plan.task: Define the purpose and goals of the hackathon. Decide on what you want to achieve and the specific outcomes you are looking for.
Choose a date and location for the hackathon. Consider factors such as venue availability, accessibility, and convenience for participants.
Assemble a team of organizers and volunteers to help plan and execute the hackathon. Assign roles and responsibilities to each team member.
Decide on the format of the hackathon, such as the duration, the number of participants, and the type of challenges or projects to be worked on.
Estimate the expenses for the hackathon, including venue rental, food and beverages, prizes, marketing, and any other costs. Create a budget and seek sponsorship if needed.
Develop a marketing strategy to promote the hackathon and attract participants. Use social media, email newsletters, flyers, and other channels to spread the word.
Arrange necessary logistics, such as securing the venue, organizing equipment and internet access, setting up workspaces, and ensuring participant safety and comfort.
Create an application or registration process for participants. Promote the hackathon to the target audience and select participants based on criteria if necessary.
Create a detailed schedule and agenda for the hackathon. Include sessions, workshops, breaks, and presentations. Ensure a balanced mix of work and networking opportunities.
Gather and provide necessary resources for participants, such as available tools, APIs, datasets, mentorship, and support. Create a repository of relevant information.
Coordinate the event on the day(s) of the hackathon. Ensure smooth execution of the agenda, handle any issues or emergencies, and provide assistance to participants.
Evaluate the projects or solutions created during the hackathon. Recognize and reward outstanding work. Collect feedback from participants and learn from the experience to improve future hackathons.
